title: 'Game over, man. Game over!': Fans pay tribute to Bill Paxton as they tweet his iconic Aliens line
text:
'Game over, man. Game over!': Fans pay tribute to Bill Paxton as they tweet his iconic Aliens line Following the actor's sudden death at the age, 61, fans took to twitter expressing their condolences Share Comments By JJ Nattrass 16:50, 26 FEB 2017 Updated 16:52, 26 FEB 2017 Celebs Bill Paxton's iconic role as Hudson in Aliens (Photo: 20th Century Fox) celebs He made cinema history when he uttered the hysterical line: "Game over, man. Game over!"
And following Bill Paxton 's death on Sunday, fans of the movie star, 61, paid tribute to him by quoting his iconic sound-bite from Aliens.
Following the news that he had died following complications after surgery , cinema devotees offered their condolences whilst also referencing his line from the 1986 blockbuster.
Read More Bill Paxton dead at 61: Aliens and Titanic actor passes away 'from surgery complications' "Game over, man. Game over!" (Photo: 20th Century Fox) Bill, who played the nervous and trigger-happy colonial marine Private Hudson, inadvertently was given one of Tinsel Town's most famous catchphrases to say.
As things take a turn for the worse in James Cameron's Aliens, Bill's character utters the line as the marine team and Sigourney Weaver's Ripley survey the wreckage of their ship after a crash landing.
And, following the actor's death, fans couldn't help but pay tribute to the Independence Day and Terminator star by quoting the line as they tweeted out their shock and condolences.
Read More Game of Thrones star and UK's tallest man Neil Fingleton dies aged 36 Fans paid tribute to Bill Paxton by tweeting his iconic line from Aliens (Photo: Rex Features) One fan, Quote: : "'Game Over Man, GAME OVER!' RIP Bill Paxton, the only man to fight and be killed by a Terminator, a Predator and a Xenomorph. He was legend!"
And it he wasn't the only cinema fan to Quote: the line, or Bill's equally impressive Sci-Fi movie credentials, as the world took stock of the actor's sudden and tragic passing.
"'Game over, man. Game over!' RIP Bill Paxton; you were amazing in so many things I loved x," wrote @houseboundgeek.
And while the messages chaged to express how some would never watch "Aliens" the same way ever again, or how tragic and unexpected his death was, ,many fans found themselves in-sync - tweeting the line out.
The star - best known for his roles in hit films such as Aliens, Apollo 13, Twister and Titanic - died suddenly on Saturday.
The star passed away on Sunday aged 61, following complications after surgery (Photo: Rex Features) In a statement his family confirmed his death and described him as a "beloved and prolific actor and filmmaker" whose "illustrious career" spanned four decades.
His family said: "It is with heavy hearts we share the news that Bill Paxton has passed away due to complications from surgery."
The statement added: "Bill's passion for the arts was felt by all who knew him, and his warmth and tireless energy were undeniable."
